properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:53AM PST until January 11 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW TODAY...

.A potent winter storm will move into the Inland Northwest
Friday. Light snow will begin in the morning hours on Friday with
snow intensity increasing Friday afternoon and night.  Snow
showers will linger through Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10
inches with highest amounts in Idaho. Winds gusting as high as
25 mph.

* WHERE...Moscow, Plummer, Potlatch, Genesee, Pullman, Colfax,
Rosalia, La Crosse, Oakesdale, Tekoa, and Uniontown.

* WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility and result in local
areas of drifting snow. The hazardous conditions will impact the
evening commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY
